Rule.desc: Make sure implementation of Object.equals(Object) properly handles null values
Make sure implementation of Object.equals(Object) is reflexive
Do not modify collection while iterating over it
Avoid NullPointerException
Avoid unvalidated input in array indexes
Avoid use before explicit initialization
Avoid use of fields before initialization in constructors and static initializers
Avoid overwriting method parameters before each use
Avoid division by zero
Avoid accessing arrays out of bounds
Avoid incorrect shift operations
Avoid conditions that always evaluate to the same value
Do not use resources that have been freed
Ensure resources are deallocated
Avoid double locking
Do not abandon unreleased locks
Do not acquire locks in different order
Do not use blocking methods while holding a lock
Use appropriate signatures for listener method names in JavaBean classes
Ensure that JavaBean classes implement 'java.io.Serializable'
Avoid method duplication
Avoid class duplication
Call 'super.clone()' in all 'clone()' methods
Do not use constructors in the 'clone()' method
Do not call an "abstract" method from a constructor in an "abstract" class
Use the 'clone()' method only to implement 'Cloneable' interface
Ensure 'clone()' method of non-final Cloneable class declared to throw 'CloneNotSupportedException'
Ensure all types have a non default package name
Avoid nested assignments or assignments embedded in other expressions
Do not declare multiple variables of different types in one statement
Declare bean classes "public"
Do not declare bean classes as "abstract"
Do not declare bean classes as "final"
Declare 'ejbCreate()' methods "public", but neither "static" nor "final"
Implement a no-argument 'ejbCreate()' method for all Message-driven bean classes
Do not define 'finalize()' method in bean classes
Declare a "public" constructor that takes no parameters in bean classes
Declare 'ejbPostCreate()' "public" and neither "static" nor "final"
Make the return type "void" for SessionBeans or MessageDrivenBeans' 'ejbCreate()' methods
Make the return type "void" for the 'ejbPostCreate()' method
Avoid passing the "this" reference as an argument
Do not return "this"
Do not access or modify security configuration objects
Declare all "static" fields in EJB bean classes "final"
The return type of EJB finder methods should be the primary key or a collection of primary keys
Do not set or create a new SecurityManager in EJBs
Avoid starting, stopping, or managing threads in any way in bean classes
Do not throw 'java.rmi.RemoteException' in a bean's local interface and local home interface
Call 'InvocationContext.proceed()' from @AroundInvoke methods
Ensure instance variables of @Stateful beans are Serializable
Do not throw exceptions from the constructors of exception classes
Do not abuse exceptions as flow control statements
Do not use instanceof in a catch block to check the exception type
Always chain thrown exceptions
Do not throw exception types which are too general or are unchecked exceptions
Do not use 'finalize()' methods to unregister listeners
Do not call 'finalize()' explicitly
Prevent potential memory leaks in ObjectOutputStreams by calling 'reset()'
Call 'super.finalize()' from 'finalize()'
Call 'super.finalize()' in the "finally" block of 'finalize()' methods
Avoid storing unencrypted Hibernate usernames and passwords in 'web.xml' files
Avoid uninitialized reads of fields before or during constructor execution
Do not use a "static" initializer that creates an instance of the current class before all "static final" fields are assigned
Avoid explicitly initializing fields which have already been initialized by a superclass' constructor
Do not use initialization circularities for fields
Do not use non-final "static" fields during the initialization
Ensure index is valid in JDBC method invocation
McCabe Cyclomatic Complexity
Nested Blocks Depth
Do not declare types with the same name as types in the Java platform
Avoid using potential Java keywords as identifiers
Do not use a package name that is reserved by Sun
Avoid using dollar signs in names
Do not use variables with identical names or names that differ only in case
Do not hide inherited fields
Do not hide inherited "static" member methods
Do not use a "private" field that is accessed in only one method; change it to a local variable
Declare "final" fields with a known compile time value as "static"
Declare member classes "static" if possible
Avoid unnecessary casting
Ensure that exactly one type has the same name as the file name
Place "default" as the last case of the "switch" statement
Provide "default:" for each "switch" statement
Do not call the 'next' method from the 'hasNext' method of an Iterator
Do not use "URL" objects in "Collections" or "Maps"
Do not call 'setSize()' in 'ComponentListener.componentResized()'
Do not create an empty JarFile entry or an empty ZipFile entry
Avoid calling 'equals(null)'
Ensure that all types which are used as keys in Sets and Maps override the 'equals()' and 'hashCode()' methods
Do not overload the 'finalize()' method
Avoid using "." as a regular expression in 'String.replaceAll()' and 'String.replaceFirst()'
Do not pass a 'char' to the 'StringBuffer(int)' constructor
Avoid improper casting of the results of the 'next' methods in the 'java.util.Random' class
Avoid using the 'equals()' and 'hashCode()' methods of "java.net.URL"
Update values which may be using to compare with vendor properties
Avoid using 'return's inside 'finally blocks if thare are other 'return's inside the try-catch block
Do not exit "finally" blocks abruptly
Do not use the "+" string concatenation operator to concatenate numbers; use it only to add numbers
Avoid erroneously placing statements outside blocks
Avoid overloading varargs methods
Do not use "char" arrays in "String" concatenations
Do not use '==' or '!=' to compare objects
Avoid dangling "else" statements
Avoid confusing assignments to constructor arguments
Avoid improper concatenation of characters with numbers
Use the method name 'main()' only for the entry point method
Do not call 'equals()' methods that always return false
Avoid calling 'equals()' with same object
Avoid infinite recursive method calls
Do not increment or decrement on the same variable over multiple nested "for" loop statements
Ensure that the objects used within a loop's condition are properly accessed within the loop's body
Avoid bugs in the usage of loop variables
Avoid out of range comparisons
Avoid calculations which result in overflow or NaN
Do not assign the result of an integer division to a floating point variable
Avoid comparisons to Double.NaN or Float.NaN
Do not initialize array dimensions with negative numbers
Do not pass floating point values to the 'BigDecimal' constructor
Do not use an integer outside the range of [0, 31] as the amount of a shift
Do not cast primitive data types to lower precision
Do not compare floating point types
Do not use floating point variables as loop indices
Avoid casting the result of an integer multiplication to "long"
Do not add a collection to itself
Check whether or not "readLine()" returned null before dereferencing the return value
Avoid using methods add() from JLayer class
When used HttpURLConnection always check return value from the getResponseCode() methods before call getInputStream()
Avoid modifying fixed-size Collections
Avoid possible ArrayStoreExceptions
Ensure 'Iterator.next()' method implementations throw 'NoSuchElementException'
Avoid assignment within a condition
Ensure that arguments passed to Java wrapper classes do not contain typos
Ensure "switch" statements do not contain typos
Avoid assigning same variable in the fall-through switch case
Do not give methods and fields the same name as the enclosing class or each other
Avoid unreachable "else if" and "else" cases
Avoid using "private" fields which are never given a meaningful value
Avoid increment and decrement statements which have no effect
Do not use the unary operator '+'
Avoid empty statements
Avoid self assignments/initializations to fields and/or local variables
Avoid duplicated property names
Avoid empty property names
Avoid misusing arguments in property values
Avoid incomplete property entries
Avoid unmatched property entries in resources with different locales
Avoid duplicated property values
Avoid empty property values
Follow the limit for number of property entries
Avoid misusing the line continuation character '\'
Ensure that property entries are localized correctly
Avoid classes that implement 'Externalizable' but do not define a no-argument constructor
Ensure the return type of 'readResolve()' and 'writeReplace()' methods are 'java.lang.Object'
Ensure outer class is serializable if its inner class is serializable
Ensure that the 'readObject()' and 'writeObject()' methods have the correct signature
Avoid serializable classes that extend a superclass without a zero-argument constructor
Ensure Serializable classes are correct
Declare 'serialPersistentFields' "private static final"
Ensure that all fields are assigned by the 'readObject()' method and written out by the 'writeObject()' method
Ensure that all servlets have a corresponding mapping in 'web.xml' files
Follow configuration class conventions
Avoid accessing a database from Action Classes
Avoid defining multiple form beans with the same name in 'struts-config.xml' files
Use the 'minlength' validator for password fields in 'validation.xml'
Ensure that the @path attribute of '<action>' and '<forward>' elements begins with '/' in 'struts-config.xml' files
Ensure that the 'scope' attribute is set to either "request" or "session" for actions and exceptions in 'struts-config.xml' files
Do not cause deadlocks by calling a "synchronized" method from a "synchronized" method
Release Locks in a "finally" block
Do not synchronize on constant Strings
Manually synchronize on 'synchronized' collections when iterating over them
Call 'wait()' and 'await()' only inside a loop that tests the liveness condition
Do not use variables of the unsafe type 'java.lang.ThreadGroup'
Do not call the "start" method of threads from inside a constructor
Do not synchronize on "public" fields since doing so may cause deadlocks
Avoid calling unsafe deprecated methods of 'Thread' and 'Runtime'
Do not call 'Thread.sleep()' while holding a lock since doing so can cause poor performance and deadlocks
Ensure 'wait()', 'notify()' and 'notifyAll()' are invoked on an object that is clearly synchronized in its enclosing method scope
Do not synchronize on non-"final" fields since doing so makes it difficult to guarantee mutual exclusion
Synchronize access to "static" SimpleDataFormats
Do not start a thread without specifying a 'run()' method
Use 'wait()' and 'notifyAll()' instead of polling loops
Avoid empty static and non-static initializers
Avoid unused labels
Avoid collection objects that are never read
Avoid local variables that are never read
Avoid duplicate code in 'if' branches
Do not explicitly "import" the java.lang.* "package"
Avoid empty "finalize()" methods
Avoid empty "synchronized" statements
Avoid unnecessary 'if' statements
Avoid redundant throw clauses
Do not import classes from the package that contains the current class

StdViol.msg: Text label 'case10' may be a typo for 'case 10'
StdViol.rule.header: Ensure "switch" statements do not contain typos

Ann.msg: Condition evaluation: key instanceof java.lang.String (assuming false)

MetViol.msg: Value 8 is out of acceptable range: 'lower than 7'

StdViol.msg: "!=" is used when comparing 'String' Objects. 'equals()' should be used instead
StdViol.rule.header: Do not use '==' or '!=' to compare objects

StdViol.rule.header: Ensure index is valid in JDBC method invocation
